snippet: Greek budget cuts are affecting archaeology, where scholars fear irreparable losses in their field.
abstract: Greek budget cuts are affecting archaeology, where scholars fear irreparable losses in their field; in the first six months of 2012, dozens of the country's most experienced state archaeologists have been forced into early retirement, and archaeological service has all but stopped hiring; experts warn that the real consequences of the cuts will not become fully apparent for years and will be far more dire for ancient artifacts and historical scholarship.
lead_paragraph: Greek budget cuts are affecting archaeology, where scholars fear irreparable losses in their field.

headline.seo: Archaeologists Say Greek Antiquities Threatened by Austerity
headline.main: Greek Antiquities, Long Fragile, Are Endangered by Austerity
